trans-unit.source: Create a periodic work item
trans-unit.target: Create a periodic work item

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a work item that repeats periodically.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a work item that repeats periodically.

trans-unit.source: Create a periodic work item
trans-unit.target: Create a periodic work item

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: CreatePeriodicTimer
trans-unit.target: CreatePeriodicTimer

trans-unit.source: ThreadPoolTimer
trans-unit.target: ThreadPoolTimer

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a work item that repeats periodically.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a work item that repeats periodically.

trans-unit.source: Create the periodic work item
trans-unit.target: Create the periodic work item

trans-unit.source: Use the [**CreatePeriodicTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967915) method to create a periodic work item.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**CreatePeriodicTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967915) method to create a periodic work item.

trans-unit.source: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the *period* parameter to specify the interval between submissions.
trans-unit.target: Supply a lambda that accomplishes the work, and use the *period* parameter to specify the interval between submissions.

trans-unit.source: The period is specified using a [**TimeSpan**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225996) structure.
trans-unit.target: The period is specified using a [**TimeSpan**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR225996) structure.

trans-unit.source: The work item will be resubmitted every time the period elapses, so make sure the period is long enough for work to complete.
trans-unit.target: The work item will be resubmitted every time the period elapses, so make sure the period is long enough for work to complete.

trans-unit.source: [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpooltimer.createtimer.aspx) returns a [**ThreadPoolTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230587) object.
trans-unit.target: [**CreateTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpooltimer.createtimer.aspx) returns a [**ThreadPoolTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/BR230587) object.

trans-unit.source: Store this object in case the timer needs to be canceled.
trans-unit.target: Store this object in case the timer needs to be canceled.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Avoid specifying a value of zero (or any value less than one millisecond) for the interval.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Avoid specifying a value of zero (or any value less than one millisecond) for the interval.

trans-unit.source: This causes the periodic timer to behave as a single-shot timer instead.
trans-unit.target: This causes the periodic timer to behave as a single-shot timer instead.

trans-unit.source: **Note** You can use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI and show progress from the work item.
trans-unit.target: **Note** You can use [**CoreDispatcher.RunAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh750317) to access the UI and show progress from the work item.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a work item that runs once every 60 seconds:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a work item that runs once every 60 seconds:

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Handle cancellation of the periodic work item (optional)
trans-unit.target: Handle cancellation of the periodic work item (optional)

trans-unit.source: If needed, you can handle cancellation of the periodic timer with a [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926).
trans-unit.target: If needed, you can handle cancellation of the periodic timer with a [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926).

trans-unit.source: Use the [**CreatePeriodicTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967915) overload to supply an additional lambda that handles cancellation of the periodic work item.
trans-unit.target: Use the [**CreatePeriodicTimer**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967915) overload to supply an additional lambda that handles cancellation of the periodic work item.

trans-unit.source: The following example creates a periodic work item that repeats every 60 seconds and it also supplies a cancellation handler:
trans-unit.target: The following example creates a periodic work item that repeats every 60 seconds and it also supplies a cancellation handler:

trans-unit.source: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]
trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.source: Cancel the timer
trans-unit.target: Cancel the timer

trans-unit.source: When necessary, call the [**Cancel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpooltimer.cancel.aspx) method to stop the periodic work item from repeating.
trans-unit.target: When necessary, call the [**Cancel**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/apps/windows.system.threading.threadpooltimer.cancel.aspx) method to stop the periodic work item from repeating.

trans-unit.source: If the work item is running when the periodic timer is cancelled it is allowed to complete.
trans-unit.target: If the work item is running when the periodic timer is cancelled it is allowed to complete.

trans-unit.source: The [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926) (if provided) is called when all instances of the periodic work item have completed.
trans-unit.target: The [**TimerDestroyedHandler**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/Hh967926) (if provided) is called when all instances of the periodic work item have completed.

trans-unit.target: [!div class="tabbedCodeSnippets"]

trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.target: For information about single-use timers, see [Use a timer to submit a work item](use-a-timer-to-submit-a-work-item.md).
